title: Torta di Mele della Nonna
description: Grandma's rustic Italian apple cake - moist, lightly spiced, and packed with fresh apples in a simple buttery batter.
instructions: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F). Butter and flour a 9-inch springform pan.
Peel, core, and slice apples into 1/4-inch slices. Toss with lemon juice to prevent browning.
In a large bowl, cream softened butter and sugar until light and fluffy, about 3 minutes.
Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Mix in vanilla extract and lemon zest.
In separate bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt.
Alternately add flour mixture and milk to butter mixture, beginning and ending with flour. Mix until just combined.
Fold in two-thirds of the apple slices until evenly distributed.
Pour batter into prepared pan and smooth top. Arrange remaining apple slices in concentric circles on top.
Sprinkle sliced almonds over apples. Bake for 50-60 minutes until golden and toothpick comes out clean.
While cake bakes, warm apricot jam with 1 tbsp water. Strain if lumpy.
Let cake cool in pan for 15 minutes, then brush warm cake with apricot glaze.
Cool completely before dusting with powdered sugar. Serve at room temperature.
